channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: MedReason: Eliciting Factual Medical Reasoning Steps in LLMs via Knowledge Graphs
item.description: Our pipeline generates detailed reasoning for various medical questions from 7 medical datasets, resulting in a dataset of 32, 682 question-answer pairs, each with detailed, step-by-step explanations.

item.title: Quantum Random Lunch Generator (QRLG)
item.description: Lunch is important and choosing where to have lunch is difficult.

item.title: Effect-driven interpretation: Functors for natural language composition
item.description: Computer programs are often factored into pure components -- simple, total functions from inputs to outputs -- and components that may have side effects -- errors, changes to memory, parallel threads, abortion of the current loop, etc.

item.title: Whispering Under the Eaves: Protecting User Privacy Against Commercial and LLM-powered Automatic Speech Recognition Systems
item.description: To address this limitation and protect live users' speech against ASR systems, we propose a novel framework, AudioShield.

item.title: Flow Matching on Lie Groups
item.description: We take an alternative point of view: we generalise to FM on Lie groups by instead substituting exponential curves for line segments.

item.title: CellVTA: Enhancing Vision Foundation Models for Accurate Cell Segmentation and Classification
item.description: To address this problem, we propose CellVTA (Cell Vision Transformer with Adapter), a novel method that improves the performance of vision foundation models for cell instance segmentation by incorporating a CNN-based adapter module.

item.title: FSSUWNet: Mitigating the Fragility of Pre-trained Models with Feature Enhancement for Few-Shot Semantic Segmentation in Underwater Images
item.description: To address this, we propose FSSUWNet, a tailored FSS framework for underwater images with feature enhancement.

item.title: Training Frozen Feature Pyramid DINOv2 for Eyelid Measurements with Infinite Encoding and Orthogonal Regularization
item.description: Accurate measurement of eyelid parameters such as Margin Reflex Distances (MRD1, MRD2) and Levator Function (LF) is critical in oculoplastic diagnostics but remains limited by manual, inconsistent methods.

item.title: Votranh V8: A Living AI Beyond Code
item.description: Votranh V8 is a living AI built in 18 days, blending Mixtral 8x22B, DeepSpeed, and a 64-qubit quantum entropy engine.

item.title: GLiNER-biomed: A Suite of Efficient Models for Open Biomedical Named Entity Recognition
item.description: Our approach first distills the annotation capabilities of large language models (LLMs) into a smaller, more efficient model, enabling the generation of high-coverage synthetic biomedical NER data.

item.title: AdaMMS: Model Merging for Heterogeneous Multimodal Large Language Models with Unsupervised Coefficient Optimization
item.description: Specifically, we first design mapping function between models to apply model merging on MLLMs with different architecture.

item.title: Introducing the Short-Time Fourier Kolmogorov Arnold Network: A Dynamic Graph CNN Approach for Tree Species Classification in 3D Point Clouds
item.description: Our experiments show that STFT-KAN outperforms existing KAN variants by effectively balancing model complexity and performance with parameter count reduction, achieving competitive results compared to MLP-based models.

item.title: Detecting Localized Density Anomalies in Multivariate Data via Coin-Flip Statistics
item.description: Detecting localized density differences in multivariate data is a crucial task in computational science.

item.title: From Colors to Classes: Emergence of Concepts in Vision Transformers
item.description: As the complexity of encoded concepts increases, the number of concepts represented in each layer also rises, reflecting a more diverse and specific set of features.

item.title: SALT: A Flexible Semi-Automatic Labeling Tool for General LiDAR Point Clouds with Cross-Scene Adaptability and 4D Consistency
item.description: We propose a flexible Semi-Automatic Labeling Tool (SALT) for general LiDAR point clouds with cross-scene adaptability and 4D consistency.

item.title: Foundation Models For Seismic Data Processing: An Extensive Review
item.description: Seismic processing plays a crucial role in transforming raw data into high-quality subsurface images, pivotal for various geoscience applications.

item.title: On the Reproducibility of Learned Sparse Retrieval Adaptations for Long Documents
item.description: Document retrieval is one of the most challenging tasks in Information Retrieval.

item.title: Combining Query Performance Predictors: A Reproducibility Study
item.description: As early as 2009, Hauff et al. [28] explored whether different QPP methods may be combined to improve prediction quality.

item.title: Short-video Propagation Influence Rating: A New Real-world Dataset and A New Large Graph Model
item.description: First, we propose a new Cross-platform Short-Video (XS-Video) dataset, which aims to provide a large-scale and real-world short-video propagation network across various platforms to facilitate the research on short-video propagation.

item.title: ZeroMimic: Distilling Robotic Manipulation Skills from Web Videos
item.description: Many recent advances in robotic manipulation have come through imitation learning, yet these rely largely on mimicking a particularly hard-to-acquire form of demonstrations: those collected on the same robot in the same room with the same objects as the trained policy must handle at test time.

item.title: Exploring Temporal Dynamics in Event-based Eye Tracker
item.description: Eye-tracking is a vital technology for human-computer interaction, especially in wearable devices such as AR, VR, and XR.

item.title: Enhancing Image Resolution of Solar Magnetograms: A Latent Diffusion Model Approach
item.description: By training a Latent Diffusion Model (LDM) with residuals on downscaled HMI data and fine-tuning it with paired MDI/HMI data, we can enhance the resolution of MDI observations from 2"/pixel to 0. 5"/pixel.

item.title: Solving the Best Subset Selection Problem via Suboptimal Algorithms
item.description: Best subset selection in linear regression is well known to be nonconvex and computationally challenging to solve, as the number of possible subsets grows rapidly with increasing dimensionality of the problem.

item.title: Tree-Guided $L_1$-Convex Clustering
item.description: Convex clustering is a modern clustering framework that guarantees globally optimal solutions and performs comparably to other advanced clustering methods.

item.title: Controlled Latent Diffusion Models for 3D Porous Media Reconstruction
item.description: Three-dimensional digital reconstruction of porous media presents a fundamental challenge in geoscience, requiring simultaneous resolution of fine-scale pore structures while capturing representative elementary volumes.

item.title: A Low-complexity Structured Neural Network to Realize States of Dynamical Systems
item.description: Thus, we utilize the StNN based on the Hankel operator to solve dynamical systems as an alternative to existing data-driven techniques.

item.title: The more the merrier: logical and multistage processors in credit scoring
item.description: On the one hand, it addresses the existent gap concerning the application of established methods in the literature to the case of multiple sensitive variables through the use of a new technique called logical processors (LP).

item.title: Point Tracking in Surgery--The 2024 Surgical Tattoos in Infrared (STIR) Challenge
item.description: Understanding tissue motion in surgery is crucial to enable applications in downstream tasks such as segmentation, 3D reconstruction, virtual tissue landmarking, autonomous probe-based scanning, and subtask autonomy.

item.title: PixelCAM: Pixel Class Activation Mapping for Histology Image Classification and ROI Localization
item.description: They also face the well-known issue of asynchronous convergence between classification and localization tasks.

item.title: Scalable Geometric Learning with Correlation-Based Functional Brain Networks
item.description: The correlation matrix is a central representation of functional brain networks in neuroimaging.

item.title: GNN-Based Candidate Node Predictor for Influence Maximization in Temporal Graphs
item.description: In an age where information spreads rapidly across social media, effectively identifying influential nodes in dynamic networks is critical.

item.title: AI-Assisted Colonoscopy: Polyp Detection and Segmentation using Foundation Models
item.description: A concept that is particularly advantageous in the medical imaging domain, where large annotated datasets for traditional training are scarce.

item.title: SU-YOLO: Spiking Neural Network for Efficient Underwater Object Detection
item.description: Underwater object detection is critical for oceanic research and industrial safety inspections.

item.title: THEMIS: Towards Practical Intellectual Property Protection for Post-Deployment On-Device Deep Learning Models
item.description: On-device deep learning (DL) has rapidly gained adoption in mobile apps, offering the benefits of offline model inference and user privacy preservation over cloud-based approaches.

item.title: Intrinsically-Motivated Humans and Agents in Open-World Exploration
item.description: What drives exploration?

item.title: Effective Cloud Removal for Remote Sensing Images by an Improved Mean-Reverting Denoising Model with Elucidated Design Space
item.description: To overcome this drawback, we develop a new CR model EMRDM based on mean-reverting diffusion models (MRDMs) to establish a direct diffusion process between cloudy and cloudless images.

item.title: InstructRestore: Region-Customized Image Restoration with Human Instructions
item.description: To achieve this, we first develop a data generation engine to produce training triplets, each consisting of a high-quality image, the target region description, and the corresponding region mask.

item.title: FineCausal: A Causal-Based Framework for Interpretable Fine-Grained Action Quality Assessment
item.description: Action quality assessment (AQA) is critical for evaluating athletic performance, informing training strategies, and ensuring safety in competitive sports.

item.title: Lorentzian Graph Isomorphic Network
item.description: We introduce the Lorentzian Graph Isomorphic Network (LGIN), a novel graph neural network (GNN) designed to operate in hyperbolic spaces, leveraging the Lorentzian model to enhance graph representation learning.

item.title: On-device Sora: Enabling Training-Free Diffusion-based Text-to-Video Generation for Mobile Devices
item.description: These results show that On-device Sora enables efficient and high-quality video generation on resource-constrained mobile devices.

item.title: Easi3R: Estimating Disentangled Motion from DUSt3R Without Training
item.description: Recent advances in DUSt3R have enabled robust estimation of dense point clouds and camera parameters of static scenes, leveraging Transformer network architectures and direct supervision on large-scale 3D datasets.

item.title: MGD-SAM2: Multi-view Guided Detail-enhanced Segment Anything Model 2 for High-Resolution Class-agnostic Segmentation
item.description: Despite their strong generalization capabilities, SAMs encounter challenges in fine-grained detail segmentation for high-resolution class-independent segmentation (HRCS), due to the limitations in the direct processing of high-resolution inputs and low-resolution mask predictions, and the reliance on accurate manual prompts.

item.title: MB-ORES: A Multi-Branch Object Reasoner for Visual Grounding in Remote Sensing
item.description: We propose a unified framework that integrates object detection (OD) and visual grounding (VG) for remote sensing (RS) imagery.

item.title: AutoEval: Autonomous Evaluation of Generalist Robot Manipulation Policies in the Real World
item.description: Scalable and reproducible policy evaluation has been a long-standing challenge in robot learning.

item.title: Beyond a Single Mode: GAN Ensembles for Diverse Medical Data Generation
item.description: The advancement of generative AI, particularly in medical imaging, confronts the trilemma of ensuring high fidelity, diversity, and efficiency in synthetic data generation.

item.title: Ride-Sourcing Vehicle Rebalancing with Service Accessibility Guarantees via Constrained Mean-Field Reinforcement Learning
item.description: The rapid expansion of ride-sourcing services such as Uber, Lyft, and Didi Chuxing has fundamentally reshaped urban transportation by offering flexible, on-demand mobility via mobile applications.

item.title: Force-Free Molecular Dynamics Through Autoregressive Equivariant Networks
item.description: Molecular dynamics (MD) simulations play a crucial role in scientific research.

item.title: An extrapolated and provably convergent algorithm for nonlinear matrix decomposition with the ReLU function
item.description: Nonlinear matrix decomposition (NMD) with the ReLU function, denoted ReLU-NMD, is the following problem: given a sparse, nonnegative matrix $X$ and a factorization rank $r$, identify a rank-$r$ matrix $\Theta$ such that $X\approx \max(0,\Theta)$.

item.title: Expanding-and-Shrinking Binary Neural Networks
item.description: While binary neural networks (BNNs) offer significant benefits in terms of speed, memory and energy, they encounter substantial accuracy degradation in challenging tasks compared to their real-valued counterparts.

item.title: Rec-R1: Bridging Generative Large Language Models and User-Centric Recommendation Systems via Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We propose Rec-R1, a general reinforcement learning framework that bridges large language models (LLMs) with recommendation systems through closed-loop optimization.
